PROJECTSLABABOUT

Soba

Open-Source Soba Project

Project Title: Scalable Soba

Scope: Cold or hot soba noodles as a reproducible, scalable system

Concept

Soba is a system defined by ratio, time, and flow. Flour composition, hydration, rolling thickness, and boiling time determine quality. These parameters scale linearly, making soba suitable as an open, reproducible food system—small batch or large volume, same rules.

BOM (Bill of Materials)

Category Item Notes
Tool Mixing bowl For dough preparation
Tool Rolling pin Thickness control
Tool Bench scraper / knife Cutting noodles
Tool Large pot Boiling noodles
Tool Strainer Noodle handling
Tool Timer Process control
Ingredient Buckwheat flour Primary material
Ingredient Wheat flour Binder (optional)
Ingredient Water Hydration control
Ingredient Soba dipping sauce (tsuyu) Or broth for hot soba
Ingredient Green onions Topping
Ingredient Wasabi Optional
Ingredient Nori Optional topping

Build Steps

  1. Define ratios

    Set flour ratio (e.g. 80% buckwheat / 20% wheat). Scale quantities linearly.

  2. Mix dough

    Gradually add water until dough holds together.

  3. Knead & rest

    Knead until smooth. Rest briefly to stabilize structure.

  4. Roll

    Roll dough to uniform thickness. Thickness directly controls cooking time and texture.

  5. Cut

    Cut into consistent-width noodles. Precision improves scalability.

  6. Boil

    Boil in large volumes of water. Batch size scales with pot capacity.

  7. Rinse / serve

    Rinse for cold soba or transfer directly to broth for hot soba.

  8. Finish

    Serve with tsuyu, toppings, and condiments.

Scalability Notes

  • Ingredient ratios scale linearly.
  • Thickness and cut width are fixed parameters.
  • Cooking time remains constant per noodle cross-section.
  • Output volume is limited only by workspace and boiling capacity.

License:

Recipes and process are open. Milling, water quality, and heat source are user-defined variables.
